TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ContentLocator extends System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorBase implements class System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable

Docs.summary: Represents an ordered set of <see cref="T:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorPart"> elements that identify an item of content.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorPart> elements defined in a ContentLocator provides a structured means to reference an external data item.
The process of resolving each <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorPart> in sequence provides the context to resolve the next <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorPart>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator"> class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance object Clone() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a modifiable deep copy clone of this <see cref="T:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator">.
Docs.returns: A modifiable deep copy clone of this <see cref="T:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator">.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This Clone method creates modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects. For convenience, Clone shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation. For more details, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The cloned <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator>'s <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property will be `false` even if this source <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator>'s <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen%2A> property was `true.`
When copying dependency properties, Clone copies resource references and data bindings (although they might no longer resolve) but does not copy not animations or the current animation values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema GetSchema() cil managed

Docs.summary: Always returns `null`. See [Annotations Schema](../Topic/Annotations%20Schema.md) for schema details.
Docs.returns: Always `null`. See [Annotations Schema](../Topic/Annotations%20Schema.md) for schema details

remarks.format: ## Remarks The GetSchema method is provided to fulfill the contract of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable> interface.

Docs.summary: Gets the collection of <see cref="T:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorPart"> elements that make up this <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator>.
Docs.value: The collection of <see cref="T:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorPart"> elements that make up this <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorPart> collection returned will never be `null`. If the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator> contains no <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorPart> objects, the returned collection will contain zero elements.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool StartsWith(class System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator locator) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator"> with the list of <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorPart> elements to compare with this <see cref="T:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator">.
Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the starting sequence of <see cref="T:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorPart"> elements in a specified <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator> are identical to those in this <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator>.
Docs.returns: `true` if the starting sequence of <see cref="T:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorPart"> elements in this <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator> matches those in the specified ; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format:
## Remarks StartsWith returns `true` the starting sequence of <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorPart> elements in this <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator> matches those in the specified .
StartsWith returns `false` if the specified contains <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorPart> elements that are different, in a different order, or more than in this <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator>.
